alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 16 at 9:28PM AKST until February 18 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THURSDAY TO 9 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and rain expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches. Highest amounts north of the Parks Highway and northeast of Palmer. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...From 11 AM Thursday to 9 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will overspread the Matanuska Valley Thursday morning. The snow is expected to transition to a mix of rain/snow by early Thursday afternoon, especially from Wasilla south and east. The precipitation is expected to remain all snow north and west of Palmer. 2 to 4 inches of snow is possible from Big Lake to Wasilla and Palmer with snow amounts closer to 4 to 8 inches for locations north of the Parks Highway and along the Glenn Highway near Sutton. Mixed rain and snow is expected to transition back to all snow by early Friday morning before tapering off.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
